author: Anonymous Calc
title: Visited accumulator redundancy
question: I often end up using both a visited accumulator and an rsf path accumulator when only one is necessary for the problem and (I don't realize) they are essentially the same in the context of the problem. If I do this on the final, would I get penalized for this redundancy?
instructor_answer:
We do not comment on how problems are graded. 
That being said, typically if your function is well designed, and the template remains intact and all your check-expects pass then you are on the right track.
